abstract: The 25th anniversary of Black Monday has prompted some remembrances — as well as warnings that big market risks remain.
snippet: The 25th anniversary of Black Monday has prompted some remembrances — as well as warnings that big market risks remain.
lead_paragraph: Wall Street looks very different nowadays than it did on Oct. 19, 1987, when the Dow Jones industrial average plunged 23 percent in a single day. But 25 years — and one global financial crisis — later, market experts are still warning of risks to the system.

headline.main: Weighing New Risks, 25 Years After the Crash
